qas.question: What Admiral called Nanjing his home?
What visiting king died in China in 1408?
What country did this visiting king come from?
What stele is at Boni's tomb?

context: As the center of the empire, early-Ming Nanjing had worldwide connections. It was home of the <a0_0>admiral Zheng He<a0_0/>, who went to sail the Pacific and Indian Oceans, and it was visited by foreign dignitaries, such as a king from <a2_0>Borneo<a2_0/> <a1_0>(Boni 渤泥)<a1_0/>, who died during his visit to China in 1408. The Tomb of the King of Boni, with a spirit way and <a3_0>a tortoise stele<a3_0/>, was discovered in Yuhuatai District (south of the walled city) in 1958, and has been restored.
